thread.title: Springsteen announces enormous 'The River' box set
thread.title_full: Springsteen announces enormous 'The River' box set

author: Bobby Olivier | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Springsteen announces enormous 'The River' box set
text:
Comments 
Thirty-five years later, Bruce Springsteen's sprawling, reckless romp will receive some very special treatment. 
After much anticipation, the Jersey icon announced Thursday a massive box set centered on his 1980 double-album "The River." The comprehensive package available Dec. 4 will include the record's original tracks, two discs of outtakes, a single-disc version of the album Springsteen had planned to release in 1979, a new documentary DVD, and a nearly three-hour concert filmed during The River tour, in Tempe, Ariz. 
MORE: Every Bruce Springsteen song, ranked 
Many of the outtakes featured are true rarities, that didn't even make the cut on Bruce's enormous "Tracks" release in 1998. A previously unreleased track called "Meet Me In The City" dropped Thursday with the announcement (listen below). 
In total, it's 52 tracks on four CDs, and four hours of never-before-seen video on three DVDs. Rolling Stone provides a complete track listing. 
An accompanying book, with more than 200 photos from "The River" era, also comes with the set. 
Pre-orders are available now on iTunes and Amazon. 
"The River," The Boss's fifth LP, marked his greatest mainstream gains to that point. The album was his first No. 1 on the Billboard 200 (10 more have followed) and "Hungry Heart" was his first Top 10 hit. "The River" officially turns 35 Saturday. 
Bobby Olivier may be reached at bolivier@njadvancemedia.com. Follow him on Twitter @BobbyOlivier . Find NJ.com on Facebook .
